item.title: I did a thing
item.description: Edit : turns out they played the long game. When I came back, they were still here so I was the only one inconvenienced by this little stunt ! Ha ! That'll teach me to act like an hero. The black Mercedes was parked like an asshat and I decided to park my shitbox next to it, even though I had plenty of other spaces. My only regret is not being there when they'll try to get up in their car.

item.title: A petulant man child.
item.description:
Even in the face of a tragedy that he caused, you can't take a moment to act like an adult. ( Two National Guard members in DC were attacked. One passed away.) They would not have been engaged if they weren't there.
He's a selfish little prick with no ability to think of anybody but himself. I cannot wait until this man is taken by natural causes. Or, preferably, removed from office and put in jail for the rest of his life.

item.title: Welp
item.description: Got my beater car to get me through school, and on the drive home from passing my masters defense, the car died. Found out a week ago the project I was working on is getting shelved and there's no more work for me. In a weird spot as im thankful for finishing school and having a good thanksgiving with family, but my future prospects are now bleak. Edit: Thank you for the kind words! To answer a few questions, the transmission gave up the ghost and won't go out of first gear anymore. I live in Texas, and the degree is in Computer Science. I'm usually a code monkey, but honestly looking for anything that can pay the bills at this point.

item.title: when humans are bros
item.description:
Stories like this warms my heart, and restores my faith in humanity a little
Bonus: a little clip of the Baltimore Symphony Orchestra playing Star Wars. Not the best-quality clip but even in this clip it sounds badass If you're ever around the area in Maryland, I highly recommend checking out a concert by this fantastic orchestra! They do a variety of programs like live movie concerts where the soundtrack is played by the orchestra as the film plays on the big screen, to pops concerts with guest stars, and of course awesome classical pieces! https://www.bsomusic.org/

item.title: Fun fact: Thanksgiving was a day of mourning-
item.description: I don’t celebrate because I do NOT like turkey, don’t like my family nor do I have friends (and have no desire to be social) and was getting low key irritated when people I never speak to will do their “due diligence” to reach out- I am not a BAHUMBUG I just don’t like the nicety of the holidays. I enjoy not being spoken to for 363 days of the year-keep that energy..

item.title: GovBrief Today #301
item.description: This is what the President of the United States posted on Thanksgiving Day. He called Minnesota's governor "seriously retarded." He mocked Rep. Ilhan Omar's (D-MN) "swaddling hijab" and repeated the debunked smear that she married her brother. He described Somalia as "decadent, backward, and crime ridden... essentially not even a country." When 20-year-old National Guard member Sarah Beckstrom succumbed to her wounds, Trump swung into action with a holiday press conference and a "Third World Countries" immigration ban. It isn't about security. His own inspector general confirmed thorough vetting of Afghan refugees. When CBS's Nancy Cordes cited that report, he called her "stupid" three times. When the New York Times documented his fatigue and limited schedule earlier in the week, he called Katie Rogers "ugly, inside and out." Counting his "Quiet, piggy" statement on Air Force One, he's attacked three female journalists in two weeks. As always, he's using tragedy to justify crackdowns he already wanted and dehumanizing anyone who isn't male, white, and agreeing with him. Want to stop missing what matters? Get every brief in your inbox, 7 nights a week. You'll get data, images, quotes, and links to help you get engaged. Sign up free at govbrief.today. #GovBriefToday #Resist Subscribe (It's Free!) - https://gbounacos.substack.com [1] https://go.govbrief.today/dc-guard-shooter [2] https://go.govbrief.today/beckstrom-death [3] https://go.govbrief.today/trump-venezuela-land-action [4] https://go.govbrief.today/us-immigration-pause [5] https://go.govbrief.today/trump-stupid-reporter [6] https://go.govbrief.today/trump-reporter-slam [7] https://go.govbrief.today/we-aint-buying-it

item.title: 21 Permian period memes
item.description:
The Permian began 298.9 and ended 251.9 million years ago, a few million years before the first known dinosaur. In the Permian amphibians and reptiles lost dominion to proto-mammals, yet they all met with ruin (art credits: a Suminia by Andrey Atuchin)
2
3
4
5
6
7. Dimetrodon and its sail-backed relatives
8. Though often lumped together with dinosaurs Dimetrodon was a synapsid, a stem-mammal closer related to us than to reptiles
9. A Cotylorhynchus
10
11
12
13
14
15
16
17
18. The Permian–Triassic extinction event was the worst mass extinction on Earth
19
20. Lystrosaurus was a rare survivor and when the Permian ended it, for a time, became the most dominant animal on Earth ever https://imgur.com/gallery/rVFfDap
